headerText: The `v-slider` component is a better visualization of the number input. It is used for gathering numerical user data.

usage.desc: Sliders reflect a range of values along a bar, from which users may select a single value. They are ideal for adjusting settings such as volume, brightness, or applying image filters.

thumb.desc: You can display a `thumb-label` while sliding or always. It It can have a custom color by setting `thumb-color` and a custom size with `thumb-size`. With `always-dirty` its color will never change, even when on `min` value.

customThumb.desc: Using the `tick-labels` prop along with a scoped slot, you can create a very customized solution.

ticks.desc: Tick marks represent predetermined values to which the user can move the slider.

discrete.desc: Discrete sliders offer a thumb label that displays the exact current amount. Using the `step` prop you can disallow selecting values outside of steps.

icons.desc: You can add icons to the slider with the `append-icon` and `prepend-icon` props. With `append-icon-cb` and `prepend-icon-cb` you can trigger a callback function when click the icon.

editableNumericValue.desc: Sliders can be combined with other components for a better display.

customColors.desc: You can set the colors of the slider using the props `color`, `track-color` and `thumb-color`.

validation.desc: Vuetify includes simple validation through the `rules` prop. The prop accepts an array of callbacks. While validating rules, the current v-model value will be passed to the callback. This callback should return either `true` or a `String`, the error message.

minMax.desc: You can set `min` and `max` values of sliders.

metronome.desc: Use slotted _prepend_ and _append_ icons to easily customize the `v-slider` to fit any situation.

props.alwaysDirty: When used with the **thumb-label** prop will always show the thumb label.
props.inverseLabel: Reverse the label position. Works with **rtl**.
props.step: If greater than 0, sets step interval for ticks
props.thumbColor: Sets the thumb and thumb label color
props.tickLabels: When provided with Array<string>, will attempt to map the labels to each step in index order
